ygData.subject: RE: Mask of Deception
ygData.msgSnippet: Ah. Well that would be annoying, fortunately for me, I don t use that song all that often in any dark area that I ve travelled. :-) But yes, I could see why
ygData.messageBody:
Ah. Well that would be annoying, fortunately for me, I don't use that song
all that often in any dark area that I've travelled. :-)

But yes, I could see why the Psalm's UV effect would overwrite the masks
effect. This is pretty much par for the course though with bard songs, as
they do conflict with a number of other buffs as well.

I wonder if this is intentional or just one of those bugs?

---Windleaf

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Roach [mailto:mike.roach@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 02, 2000 7:57 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask of Deception
>
>
> From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>
>
> Its not accelerando (or any other song as far as I can tell)
> that cancels
> out the UV, its Psalm of Warmth.
>
> Psalm of Warmth has cold resist + damage shield + UV affect.
> When the song
> pulses the UV affect overrides the affect from the mask so
> that when you
> stop singing it you no longer have UV. Stop all songs and
> right click your
> Mask again and the UV will return.
>
> -Faras
>
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:jht@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, February 02, 2000 9:53 AM
> > To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask of Deception
> >
> >
> > From: John Tatsukawa <jht@...>
> >
> > Tested it this morning in Neriak. I have no problems using
> > it. I get the
> > Ultravision tinge. I started up accelerando, then turned off
> > accelerando.
> > Still had the blue tinge.
> >
> > So it works fine for me as well.
> >
> > Windleaf, 28th level balladeer, Half Elf, Bertox.
> >

> > > bluish/purplish) works fine. :)
